original: Lindholmer, Hugo Esaias (Esse), fd. överste, Gränna, f. 27/12/76 i Jönköp. av Joh. o. Charlotta Lindholmer. G. 05 m. Gotton Maria Lindgren. Barn: Björn f. 11, med. lic. — Mog:ex. i Jönköp. 97, off:ex. 99, Gci 05-06, KHS 06-08. Stud:resa t. Ryssl. (Moskva) 09-10. Und:löjtn. 99, löjtn. 05, kapt. 15, allt v. Jönköp. reg., kapt. v. Kronob. reg. 16, major v. Jämtl. fältjäg:reg. 23, öv:löjtn. v. Västg. reg. 26, v. Älvsb. reg. 28, överste i III. förd. res. 32. Lär. i fältmäss. skjutn. v. SS å Rosersberg 09-10, i krigskonst v. KS 11-19, bef. f. ro. 34 32-38. Skr.: Ensk. mans ut-bildn. i eldstrid (10). RSO, Skytte-Gm.
translated: Lindholmer, Hugo Esaias (Esse), former colonel, Gränna, b. 27/12/76 in Jönköping to Johan and Charlotta Lindholmer. Married in 1905 to Gotton Maria Lindgren. Children: Björn, b. 1911, medical licentiate. Completed intermediate examination in Jönköping in 1897, officer examination in 1899, trainee at General Staff Course in 1905-1906, Royal War Academy 1906-1908. Studied in Moscow on a study trip to Russia in 1909-1910. Promoted to second lieutenant in 1899, lieutenant in 1905, captain in 1915, all in Jönköping regiment. Captain in Kronoberg regiment in 1916, major in Jämtland Ranger Regiment in 1923, lieutenant colonel in Västgöta regiment in 1926, in Älvsborg regiment in 1928, colonel in the III Military District Reserve in 1932. Instructor in field shooting at the Swedish Armed Forces Combat School in Rosersberg in 1909-1910, instructor in military art at the War College from 1911 to 1919, and commander of the [unknown unit] from 1932 to 1938. Author of the book "Individual Soldier Training in Combat" (1910). Awarded with the Royal Order of the Sword and the Shooting Medal.

work.name: Field Shooting Instructor
work.issuedBy: Swedish Armed Forces Combat School, Rosersberg
